docs.title: GeoCat Product CVE Records
docs.text:
The following Common vulnerabilities and Exposures (CVE) records are subject to GeoCat Coordinated Vulnerability disclosure policy. GeoCat works with our customers, the open source community, and security researchers world wide.

Note

Use the Search field above to quickly explore CVE records.

docs.title: GeoCat Products and Technologies
docs.text:
This documentation contains the following topics:

  • GeoCat Live

    GeoCat Live CVE Records

  • GeoCat Find

    GeoCat Find CVE Records

docs.title: Free and Open Source
docs.text:
GeoCat products and services are built using a wide variety of technologies from communities and vendors.

The following CVE records are of interest to GeoCat customers, either directly affecting our products, or subject to assessment due to widespread publicity.

This documentation contains the following topics:

  • PostgreSQL and PostGIS

    PostgreSQL Database and extensions including PostGIS

  • Spring

    Spring Framework and Spring Boot Java Environment.

docs.title: CVE-2021-23337 Arbitrary Code Execution in Apache Commons Text vulnerability for GeoNetwork Enterprise
docs.text:
Vulnerability subject to the GeoCat Find responsible disclosure policy. This policy applies to you our customers, please do not share this sensitive content.

2024-02-10: Arbitrary Code Execution in Apache Commons Text CVE-2022-42889 vulnerability for GeoNetwork Enterprise

Running Pentest tools identifies lodash 4.17.15 as having several known XSS vulnerabilities assessed as Medium.

docs.title: Evaluation
docs.text:
No evaluation provided, the affected library has been updated.

It is unknown if any of the specific vulnerabilities above is exploitable via the geonetwork-user interface

docs.title: Mitigation
docs.text: No mitigation provided as exploit not provided.

docs.title: Resolution
docs.text: Update to GeoNetwork Enterprise 2023.2.

docs.title: References
docs.text:
• Lodash 4.17.15 scan command injection vulnerability
  • CVE-2021-23337 Lodash versions prior to 4.17.21 are vulnerable to Command Injection via the template function
  • CVE-2020-28500 Lodash versions prior to 4.17.21 are vulnerable to Regular Expression Denial of Service (ReDoS) via the toNumber, trim and trimEnd functions

docs.title: CVE-2021-44228 Log4j2 Remote Code Execution vulnerability patch for GeoNetwork Enterprise
docs.text:
Vulnerability subject to the GeoCat Find responsible disclosure policy. This policy applies to you our customers, please do not share this sensitive content.

2021-12-09: Log4j2 Remote Code Execution vulnerability patch for GeoNetwork Enterprise

A zero-day exploit affecting the popular Apache Log4j2 utility (CVE-2021-44228) was made public on December 9, 2021 that results in remote code execution (RCE).

docs.title: Evaluation:
docs.text: GeoNetwork Enterprise 2020.5.5 and earlier are vulnerable.

docs.title: Mitigation:
docs.text:
Users using GeoNetwork Enterprise 2020.5.5 and earlier are advised to apply the following hotfix.

  1. Download the file log4j-core-2.7.jar:

    • https://nexus.geocat.net/repository/enterprise/2020.5.5/hotfix/log4j-core-2.7.jar (enterprise login required)
    • https://drive.geocat.net/s/jgnwiWq9GMNZdpx

  2. This hotfix removes the JndiLookup.class class to mitigate the issue as described in CVE-2021-44228.

    The vulnerability relies on using JNDI to contact an LDAP service, by removing JndiLookup.class this vulnerability is mitigated.

  3. Stop Tomcat.

  4. Copy the log4j-core-2.7.jar to the folder TOMCAT_DIR/geonetwork/WEB-INF/lib.

    It is important that this file replace the existing jar at this location.

  5. Restart Tomcat.

Customers making use of geonetwork.war as part of automated deployment are asked to repackage the geonetwork war to include the above log4j-core-2.7.jar file (to avoid Tomcat redeploying the vulnerability on restart).

docs.title: Resolution:
docs.text: Please update to GeoNetwork Enterprise 2020.5.6-1 which makes use of the recommended Apache Log4j 2.17.0 library not subject to this vulnerability.

docs.title: References
docs.text:
• Apache Log4j2 Security Vulnerabilities
  • CVE-2021-44228

docs.title: CVE-2021-45046 Log4j2 Denial of Service Attack vulnerability for GeoNetwork Enterprise
docs.text:
Vulnerability subject to the GeoCat Find responsible disclosure policy. This policy applies to you our customers, please do not share this sensitive content.

2021-12-16: Log4j2 Denial of Service Attack vulnerability for GeoNetwork Enterprise

It was found that the Apache Log4j 2.15.0 fix to address CVE-2021-44228 was incomplete in certain non-default configurations.

CVE-2021-45046 Apache Log4j2 Thread Context Message Pattern and Context Lookup Pattern vulnerable to a denial of service attack.

docs.title: Evaluation:
docs.text: GeoNetwork does not use Thread Context Map values in GeoNetwork logger layouts. Therefor GeoNetwork is not vulnerable for this exploit.

docs.title: Mitigation:
docs.text: Out of an abundance of caution we have updated our services with the latest log4j 2.16.0 version that fixes the vulnerability.

docs.title: Resolution:
docs.text:
Please update to GeoNetwork Enterprise 2020.5.6-1 which makes use of the recommended Apache Log4j 2.17.0 library not subject to this vulnerability.

GeoCat will not release updated versions of the Community edition shortly. We consider the latest community releases safe enough with above hot-fix mitigation available. However, you can build the release yourself. The source code already uses the latest version of log4j2.

docs.title: CVE-2022-42889 Arbitrary Code Execution in Apache Commons Text vulnerability for GeoNetwork Enterprise
docs.text:
Vulnerability subject to the GeoCat Find responsible disclosure policy. This policy applies to you our customers, please do not share this sensitive content.

2022-10-17: Arbitrary Code Execution in Apache Commons Text CVE-2022-42889 vulnerability for GeoNetwork Enterprise

CVE-2022-42889 has been discovered in the popular Apache Commons Text library. Versions of this library from 1.5 up to but not including 1.10.0 are affected by this vulnerability.

docs.title: Evaluation
docs.text:
The commons text vulnerability relies on string interpolation:

  • GeoNetwork doesn't use any function provided by Commons Text in its source code.
  • The included GeoTools library makes use of a vulnerable Commons Text version, however only the WordUtils.abbreviate(...) and WordUtils.capitalizeFully() methods are used, and these do not perform string interpolation.

In summary: GeoNetwork is not affected by CVE-2022-42889 even when it includes a vulnerable commons-text version.

docs.title: Mitigation
docs.text: GeoNetwork is not affected by this vulnerability. No action is needed.

docs.title: References
docs.text:
• CVE-2022-428
  • GHSL-2022-018: Arbitrary Code Execution in Apache Commons Text - CVE-2022-42889
  • geonetwork/core-geonetwork#6631: Apache Commons Text - CVE-2022-42889 (Text4Shell)
  • geotools/geotools#4048: Bump org.apache.commons:commons-text from 1.6 to 1.10.0

docs.title: CVE-2024-32037 Search end-point information disclosure in response headers
docs.text:
Vulnerability subject to the GeoCat Find responsible disclosure policy. This policy applies to you our customers, please do not share this sensitive content.

2024-04-16: Search end-point information disclosure in response headers

CVE-2024-32037 has been reported for the GeoNetwork search end-point. This vulnerability reflects the unintentional disclosure of the version of Elasticsearch being used.

docs.title: Evaluation
docs.text:
GeoNetwork search end-point acts as a proxy to Elasticsearch engine. The responses included information on the Elasticserach version being used.

This vulnerability score is "low".

docs.title: Mitigation
docs.text: No mitigation is available.

docs.title: Resolution
docs.text: Update to GeoNetwork Enterprise 2023.2.

docs.title: References
docs.text:
• CVE-2024-32037
  • GHSA-52rf-25hq-5m33 Search end-point information disclosure in response headers

docs.title: CVE-2024-36404 Remote Code Execution (RCE) vulnerability in evaluating GeoTools XPath expressions
docs.text:
Vulnerability subject to the GeoCat Find responsible disclosure policy. This policy applies to you our customers, please do not share this sensitive content.

2024-07-01: Remote Code Execution (RCE) vulnerability in evaluating GeoTools XPath expressions

Assessment of GeoNetwork exposure to vulnerability in GeoTools vulnerability in evaluating XPath expressions when retrieving features or processing XML documents.

docs.title: Evaluation
docs.text:
GeoNetwork Enterprise (all versions) is not vulnerable:

  • GeoNetwork 4.2 use of DataStore in WFS Harvester, used to retrieve FeatureType information and not feature content.
  • GeoNetwork 4.2 use of DataStore in WFS Feature Harvester, used to retrieve all features (and does not make use of XPath expression).
  • GeoNetwork 3.12 use of DataStore query to establish search results by bounding box does not make use of XPath expression.

docs.title: Mitigation
docs.text: No mitigation required.

docs.title: CVE-2024-38816 Path traversal vulnerability in functional web frameworks
docs.text:
Vulnerability subject to the GeoCat Find responsible disclosure policy. This policy applies to you our customers, please do not share this sensitive content.

2024-10-31: Path traversal vulnerability in functional web frameworks CVE-2024-38816

Assessment of GeoNetwork exposure to vulnerability in Spring Framework Web Model View Controller library.

docs.title: Evaluation
docs.text:
GeoNetwork Enterprise (all versions) are not vulnerable:

  • Use of Spring Framework StrictHttpFirewall precludes this vulnerability
  • Use of Tomcat and Jetty operational environment is not subject to this vulnerability

docs.title: Mitigation
docs.text: No mitigation required.

docs.title: References
docs.text:
• CVE-2024-38816 / GHSA-cx7f-g6mp-7hqm
  • https://spring.io/security/cve-2024-38816

docs.title: CVE-2021-44228 Log4j2 Remote Code Execution vulnerability patch for GeoCat Live
docs.text:
Vulnerability subject to the GeoCat Live responsible disclosure policy. This policy applies to you our customers, please do not share this sensitive content.

**2021-12-09: Log4j2 Remote Code Execution vulnerability patch for GeoCat Live

A zero-day exploit affecting the popular Apache Log4j2 utility (CVE-2021-44228) was made public on December 9, 2021 that results in remote code execution (RCE).

Evaluation:

GeoCat Live mapping services are not subject to this vulnerability.

GeoCat Live catalogue services are subject to this vulnerability, and have been updated (see mitigation below).

Mitigation:

GeoCat Live catalogue services were patched with an emergency "hotfix", removing the JndiLookup.class class to mitigate the issue as described in CVE-2021-44228.

The vulnerability relies on using JNDI to contact an LDAP service, by removing JndiLookup.class this vulnerability is mitigated.

Resolution:

GeoCat Live catalogue services updated to GeoServer Enterprise 2020.5.6-1, which makes use of the Apache Log4j 2.17.0 library not subject to this vulnerability.

Reference:

  • CVE-2021-44228
  • CVE-2021-45046

docs.title: CVE-2022-1552: Autovacuum, REINDEX, and others omit "security restricted operation" sandbox
docs.text:
Vulnerability subject to the GeoCat Live responsible disclosure policy. This policy applies to you our customers, please do not share this sensitive content.

CVE-2022-1552: Autovacuum, REINDEX, and others omit "security restricted operation" sandbox

Evaluation:

This issue affects GeoCat Live 2022.4 and earlier.

PostgreSQL reports: "An attacker having permission to create non-temp objects in at least one schema could execute arbitrary SQL functions under a superuser identity."

Mitigation:

Organizations providing staff with VPN access to their GeoCat Live PostgreSQL instance may choose to limit access until this issue is resolved.

PostgreSQL recommendation:

While promptly updating PostgreSQL is the best remediation for most users, a user unable to do that can work around the vulnerability by disabling autovacuum, not manually running the above commands (REINDEX, CREATE INDEX, REFRESH MATERIALIZED VIEW, CLUSTER, and pg_amcheck), and not restoring from output of the pg_dump command. Performance may degrade quickly under this workaround. VACUUM is safe, and all commands are fine when a trusted user owns the target object.

Resolution:

Resolved in GeoCat Live 2022.5 update to PostgreSQL 13.8.

Reference:

  • CVE-2022-1552: Autovacuum, REINDEX, and others omit "security restricted operation" sandbox

docs.title: CVE-2022-22965 SpringShell
docs.text:
Vulnerability subject to the GeoCat Live responsible disclosure policy. This policy applies to you our customers, please do not share this sensitive content.

2022-04-04: SpringShell

Evaluation:

GeoCat Live services are not subject to this vulnerability. Services are presently operating with Java 8 which is not subject to this vulnerability.

Mitigation:

None required.

Resolution:

None required.

Reference:

  • CVE-2022-22965

docs.title: CVE-2022-24818 Unchecked JNDI lookups in GeoTools
docs.text:
Vulnerability subject to the GeoCat Live responsible disclosure policy. This policy applies to you our customers, please do not share this sensitive content.

2022-04-11: Unchecked JNDI lookups in GeoTools

Evaluation:

A Java JNDI Deserialization vulnerability has been found in GeoServer when configuring:

  • Data stores using JNDI
  • Disk Quota for GeoWebCache
  • JDBC user/role providers

Mitigation:

None required, services have been patched.

Resolution:

GeoCat Live mapping services were patched with update 2022.2.

Reference:

  • GHSA-jvh2-668r-g75x
  • CVE-2022-24818

docs.title: CVE-2024-3094 xz-utils results in a backdoor in sshd
docs.text:
Vulnerability subject to the GeoCat Live responsible disclosure policy. This policy applies to you our customers, please do not share this sensitive content.

2024-04-02: xz-utils results in a backdoor in sshd

Evaluation:

Malicious code was discovered in the upstream tarballs of xz, starting with version 5.6.0. Through a series of complex obfuscations, the liblzma build process extracts a prebuilt object file from a disguised test file existing in the source code, which is then used to modify specific functions in the liblzma code. This results in a modified liblzma library that can be used by any software linked against this library, intercepting and modifying the data interaction with this library.

Mitigation:

None required, the Ubuntu OS used in GeoCat Live or other GeoCat systems have not been affected.

Resolution:

GeoCat Live is not affected by the vulnerability.

The affected version of xz-utils and liblzma5 was only in noble-proposed, and was removed before migrating to noble itself. No released versions of Ubuntu were affected by this issue.

Reference:

CVE-2024-3094

docs.title: CVE-2024-6387 regreSSHion: Remote Unauthenticated Code Execution Vulnerability in OpenSSH server
docs.text:
Vulnerability subject to the GeoCat Live responsible disclosure policy. This policy applies to you our customers, please do not share this sensitive content.

2024-07-02: regreSSHion: Remote Unauthenticated Code Execution Vulnerability in OpenSSH server

Evaluation:

On July 1, 2024, a new OpenSSH unauthenticated remote code execution (RCE) vulnerability dubbed regreSSHion was reported, affecting glibc-based Linux systems. This vulnerability, identified as CVE-2024-6387, allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code as root due to a signal handler race condition in sshd.

This vulnerability, if exploited, could lead to full system compromise, where an attacker can execute arbitrary code with the highest privileges, resulting in a complete system takeover, installation of malware, data manipulation, and the creation of backdoors for persistent access. It could facilitate network propagation, allowing attackers to use a compromised system as a foothold to traverse and exploit other vulnerable systems within the organization.

Mitigation:

The Ubuntu OS used in GeoCat Live or other GeoCat systems have been updated with the packages that the Linux distribution released before the disclosure. In addition SSH ports are not publicly open and can only be connected from certain IP addresses.

Resolution:

OpenSSH server and client where updated to versions that contain the patch to fix this vulnerability.

Reference:

CVE-2024-6387

Qualys blog post

docs.title: CVE-2025-30220 XML External Entity (XXE) Processing Vulnerability in GeoServer WFS Service
docs.text:
Vulnerability subject to the GeoCat Map responsible disclosure policy. This policy applies to you our customers, please do not share this sensitive content.

2025-02-07: XML External Entity (XXE) Processing Vulnerability in GeoServer WFS Service

An XML External Entity (XXE) vulnerability exists in the processing of XML-based WFS requests (e.g., GetPropertyValue, DescribeFeatureType).

Evaluation:

All GeoCat Map releases are presently affected by this vulnerability.

XXE: By manipulating the xsi:schemaLocation attribute to point to an attacker-controlled external resource, it's possible to trigger the parsing of external DTDs and entities, bypassing standard entity resolvers. This allows for Out-of-Band (OOB) data exfiltration of local files accessible by the GeoServer process.

SSRF: The above mechanism asks GeoServer to make HTTP requests to arbitrary URLs, potentially enabling Service Side Request Forgery (SSRF) attacks against internal network resources.

Resolution:

A patch is presently being prepared and will be made available to GeoCat customers prior to public disclosure.

  • GeoCat Map 2025.1
  • GeoServer 2.27.1

Reference:

  • CVE-2025-30220
  • GHSA-826p-4gcg-35vw
